The tomb’s provisions were divided into bundles.
Mats and fire-arms from the chief’s tomb formed light baggage.
Preparations were made inside a palisaded enclosure unknown to the savages.
The steward served a farewell feast.
The sun disappeared behind dense clouds.
A distant thunder rumbled above the sky.
The mountain summit became shrouded in darkness.
The Maoris could no longer see their prisoners.
